marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Generally, we see that 3Q25 performance was not as bad as 2Q25 performance from the perspective of comparison against expectations. Although some issuers still recorded performance below expectations, this time the number was not as high as when 2Q25 results were released. In fact, several issuers/sectors recorded results that exceeded expectations/showed solid recovery in 3Q25, such as $UNVR, tobacco ($HMSP and $GGRM), and dairy ($CMRY and $ULTJ). Meanwhile, $ACES, $MYOR, and $TLKM still recorded performance below consensus expectations. With the 3Q25 results, we generally see that the risk of downward revision of performance estimates tends to be limited and could even be revised upwards along with expectations for economic recovery starting in 4Q25.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Finance Predicts 2025 Economic Growth at +5.2% YoY, Driven by Stimulus
marketNews.content: The Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, said on Monday (3/11) that the government forecasts economic growth during 2025 will reach +5.2% YoY, supported by economic stimulus. This forecast is in line with the initial 2025 State Budget target and higher compared to the 2025 outlook, which is in the range of +4.7-5% YoY. Purbaya also reaffirmed the expectation of economic growth exceeding +5.5% YoY in 4Q25. Purbaya also projected that investment and consumption will continue to strengthen, in line with the improving investment climate and government spending to support demand and production activities.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's October 2025 YoY Inflation Reaches 2.86%, Driven by Jewelry, Chili, and Poultry Prices
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's Consumer Price Index inflation in October 2025 reached 2.86% YoY (vs. September 2025: 2.65% YoY inflation), marking the highest inflation since April 2024 although still in line with Bank Indonesia's target range of 1.5-3.5% YoY. Monthly, inflation reached 0.28% MoM (vs. September 2025: 0.21% MoM inflation). Core inflation reached 2.36% YoY (vs. September 2025: 2.19% YoY inflation). BPS explained that monthly inflation in October 2025 was driven by the jewelry commodity with a contribution of 0.21 percentage point, red chili with a contribution of 0.06 percentage point, and eggs and broiler chicken with contributions of 0.04 and 0.02 percentage point, respectively. According to BPS, jewelry inflation was influenced by rising gold prices in the global market, chili inflation was influenced by decreased production, while egg and broiler chicken inflation was driven by increased demand in line with the Free Nutritious Meal program.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Manufacturing PMI Rises to 51.2 in October 2025, Signaling Expansion for Three Consecutive Months
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in October 2025 rose to 51.2 (vs. September 2025: 50.4), marking factory activity expansion for the 3rd consecutive month. This result was driven by rising new orders for the 3rd consecutive month, which supported stable production along with the fastest employment growth pace since May 2025. Price pressures remained high, with producers recording the sharpest average cost increase in the last 8 months following reports of rising raw material prices. Nevertheless, companies tended to be cautious about passing on cost increases to customers, so selling prices only increased slightly as an effort to maintain price competitiveness. Optimism regarding the outlook for the next 12 months decreased compared to September 2025 and was below the historical average, although the Future Output Index still showed solid optimism for the coming year along with expectations of stronger demand conditions and new product launches.

marketNews.title: OPEC+ Agrees to Increase December Oil Production Target, Pauses Further Increases for 1Q26 Amid Glut Concerns
marketNews.content: OPEC+ on Sunday (2/11) agreed to increase the oil production target by 137,000 barrels per day in December 2025, in line with expectations. This increase means OPEC+ has raised its oil production target by approximately 2.9 million barrels per day since April 2025, equal to 2.7% of global supply, as the group attempts to reclaim its market share. However, OPEC+ announced it would temporarily halt production increases for the 1Q26 period due to concerns about supply glut.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus Reaches USD 4.34 Billion in September 2025, Driven by Non-Oil & Gas Exports
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 4.34 billion US dollars in September 2025 (vs. September 2024: surplus 3.18 billion US dollars; August 2025: surplus 5.49 billion US dollars), below the consensus expectation of approximately 4.79 billion US dollars. This result was influenced by a surge in exports of +11.41% YoY, marking the fastest export growth since February 2025, while imports grew by +7.17% YoY. Export growth in September 2025 was driven by non-oil and gas exports, especially precious metals and jewelry, iron and steel, as well as fats and vegetable and animal oils. Cumulatively over 9M25, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 33.48 billion US dollars (vs. 9M24: surplus 22.18 billion US dollars), with exports and imports increasing by +8.14% YoY and +2.62% YoY, respectively.

marketNews.title: Eni and Petronas Form Joint Venture to Combine Upstream Oil & Gas Assets in Indonesia and Malaysia, Planning Over USD 15 Billion Investment
marketNews.content: Eni and Petronas on Monday (3/11) announced the formation of a joint venture company that will combine the upstream oil and gas assets of both companies in Indonesia and Malaysia. The joint venture entity will manage 19 assets - 14 in Indonesia and 5 in Malaysia - with an investment plan exceeding 15 billion US dollars over the next 5 years, aiming to develop approximately 3 billion barrels of oil equivalent of already discovered reserves and explore another 10 billion barrels of oil equivalent.

marketNews.title: China's Manufacturing PMI Drops to 50.6 in October 2025, Below Expectations Amid Trade Uncertainty
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that China's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in October 2025 fell to 50.6 (vs. September 2025: 51.2), lower than the consensus expectation of 50.9. This result was pressured by slower growth in both new orders and output, with export sales declining at the fastest pace since May 2025 due to increased trade uncertainty. Employment increased for the first time in the last 7 months, but business sentiment dropped to a 6-month low due to concerns about potential greater trade barriers.

marketNews.title: Government to Revise Regulation on Final Income Tax for MSMEs; 0.5% Rate Extended Indefinitely for Individuals and Sole Proprietorships
marketNews.content: The Deputy of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, stated to Kontan on Sunday (2/11) that the government is in the process of revising Government Regulation No. 55/2022, which will eventually include a final Income Tax (PPh) incentive for the MSME sector at a rate of 0.5% without any time limit for individual MSMEs and sole proprietorship MSMEs. In addition, the revision of this regulation will also stipulate the extension of the 0.5% final PPh for cooperative MSMEs until the 2029 tax year.

marketNews.title: Foreign Tourist Visits to Indonesia Reach ~1.4 Million in September 2025, 9M25 Growth at +10.2% YoY
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that foreign tourist visits to Indonesia reached approximately 1.4 million people in September 2025 (+9% YoY, -7.3% MoM). This result brought cumulative foreign tourist visits during 9M25 to grow by +10.2% YoY to approximately 11.4 million people, equivalent to 71-82% of the government's 2025 target in the range of 14-16 million people.

marketNews.title: Investment Lesson for Beginner Investors: "What matters is not how fast you get rich, but how rightly you earn that wealth."
marketNews.content: "Yang penting bukan seberapa cepat kamu kaya, tapi seberapa pantas kamu mendapat kekayaan itu." - blackmon14

tickerNews.title: MAPA Records IDR 500 Billion Net Profit in 3Q25 (-3% YoY, +55% QoQ), 9M25 Net Profit +5% YoY in Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: $MAPA: MAP Aktif Adiperkasa recorded net profit of 500 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-3% YoY, +55% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 1.2 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 77% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. the last 2-year average: ~77% annual realization). Revenue in 3Q25 grew double digit (+14% YoY, 15% QoQ), which likely still stems from expansion. As a note, SSSG data for 3Q25 is not yet available, while SSSG in 2Q25 contracted -5% YoY. Revenue performance in 3Q25 brought 9M25 revenue to 13.9 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 72% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. the last 2-year average: ~71% annual realization). Gross profit margin in 3Q25 slightly decreased to 46.1% (vs. 3Q24: 46.6%, 2Q25: 46.9%), alongside higher inventory during 9M25 with inventory days reaching 204 days (vs. 9M24: 192 days). However, improved opex control kept the operating profit margin in 3Q25 relatively stable year-on-year at 14.1% (vs. 3Q24: 14.4%, 2Q25: 10.9%), so operating profit grew +11% YoY and +49% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: CMRY Revises Up 2025 Guidance Following 9M25 Performance
tickerNews.content: $CMRY: Cisarua Mountain Dairy announced a revision upwards of its 2025 guidance during the earnings call on Monday (3/11) as follows: 1) revenue growth to +15-20% YoY, from the previous +10-15% YoY (vs. 9M25: +19% YoY); 2) gross profit margin in the range of 44-46%, from the previous range of 42-44% (vs. 9M25: 45.4%); and 3) 2025 net profit is estimated to reach ~2 trillion rupiah, implying an increase of +32% YoY (vs. 9M25: +39% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ADMR Records USD 64 Million Net Profit in 3Q25 (-15% QoQ, -24% YoY), 9M25 Net Profit Below Expectation at USD 204 Million
tickerNews.content: $ADMR: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia recorded net profit of 64 million US dollars in 3Q25 (-15% QoQ, -24% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 204 million US dollars (-39% YoY), below expectations as it equals 67% of the consensus 2025F estimate. The quarterly decline in net profit in 3Q25 was pressured by a shrinking gross profit margin to 37.9% (vs. 2Q25: 40%), along with a decrease in sales volume (-4% QoQ) followed by a decrease in average selling price per ton (-1% QoQ). Meanwhile, the decline in net profit over 9M25 was pressured by weakening sales (-20% YoY) due to a decrease in average selling price (-31% YoY), which also suppressed the gross profit margin to 39.7% (vs. 9M24: 51.9%) despite a sales volume increase of +17% YoY.

tickerNews.title: AADI Records USD 587 Million Net Profit in 9M25 (-45% YoY), In Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: $AADI: Adaro Andalan Indonesia recorded net profit of 159 million US dollars in 3Q25 (-32% QoQ, -26% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 587 million US dollars (-45% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 75% of the consensus 2025F estimate. The net profit performance in 3Q25 was pressured by a shrinking gross profit margin to 20.5% (-770 bps QoQ, -411 bps YoY), along with a decrease in the average selling price per ton (-8% QoQ) amid an increase in cash cost per ton (+2% QoQ). On the top-line side, revenue in 3Q25 decreased by -2% QoQ, although sales volume increased by +6% QoQ. Meanwhile, the decline in net profit during 9M25 occurred along with weakening sales (-11% YoY) due to a decline in average selling price (-14% YoY), which also compressed the gross profit margin (-151 bps YoY). Additionally, there was a high-base effect from the gain on the sale of ownership in Adaro Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR) amounting to 323 million US dollars in 2Q24.

tickerNews.title: TSPC Records IDR 1.14 Trillion Net Profit in 9M25 (+5% YoY), In Line with Stockbit Estimates
tickerNews.content: $TSPC: Tempo Scan Pacific recorded net profit of 434 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+66% YoY, +48% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 1.14 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY), in line with our expectations (74% of Stockbit 2025F estimate). Revenue in 3Q25 already showed further recovery, with growth of +5% YoY (vs. 2Q25: -0.4% YoY, 1Q25: -5% YoY) supported by annual growth in all segments. This result made 9M25 revenue flat at 10.1 trillion rupiah (vs. 1H25: -3% YoY). Meanwhile, opex increased by +1% YoY/+6% YoY in 3Q25/9M25, so operating profit still grew slightly in 3Q25 (+2% YoY) despite contracting during 9M25 (-12% YoY). The net profit in 3Q25 was helped by other income of 19 billion rupiah, mainly supported by foreign exchange gains (vs. 3Q24: other expenses of 161 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: NCKL 3Q25 Nickel Pig Iron Sales Volume +56% YoY to 51,909 Tons; HPAL Nickel Sulfate Sales Volume -1% YoY
tickerNews.content: $NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada recorded nickel pig iron sales volume of 51,909 tons (+27% QoQ, +56% YoY) in 3Q25, so total nickel pig iron sales volume during 9M25 grew +41% YoY to 136,726 tons. From the production results of the HPAL smelter, sales volume of nickel in mixed hydroxide precipitate form reached 24,755 tons in 3Q25 (+1% QoQ, +7% YoY), while nickel sulfate sales volume was 9,793 tons (-8% QoQ, -1% YoY). This result brought nickel sales volume in the form of mixed hydroxide precipitate to grow +74% YoY during 9M25 to 68,989 tons, while nickel sulfate grew +7% YoY to 30,869 tons. On the mining side, saprolite ore sales volume reached 3.77 million wmt in 3Q25 (+46% QoQ, +119% YoY), while limonite ore sales reached 5.13 million wmt (+20% QoQ, +1% YoY). This resulted in saprolite ore sales volume during 9M25 growing +59% YoY to 8.14 million wmt, while limonite ore grew +31% YoY to 13.12 million wmt.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Records 3Q25 Production Volume of 1,329 GWh (+9% YoY), Average Selling Price at 8.27 US Cents/kWh
tickerNews.content: $PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a production volume of 1,329 GWh in 3Q25 (+9% YoY, +8% QoQ), so the total production volume during 9M25 reached 3,744 GWh (+4% YoY) or equivalent to 75% of the 2025 target of 4,978 GWh. The average selling price in 3Q25 reached 8.27 US cents per kWh (+2% YoY, +3% QoQ), with the average production cost reaching 5.57 US cents per kWh (+37% YoY, +21% QoQ). Cumulatively over 9M25, the average selling price tended to be flat at 8.16 US cents per kWh (+0.1% YoY), while the average production cost jumped +17% YoY to 4.92 US cents per kWh.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director Yulisar Khiat Acquires ~40.9 Million Shares, Increasing Direct Ownership to 6.2%
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: The Controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, purchased ~40.9 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,482 rupiah per share on [24](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202510/43ec2f868d_f3ee7883d3.pdf)-[27](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202511/0ad627b582_f75d9e8aad.pdf) October 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 60.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Yulisar Khiat's direct ownership stake in HEAL increased from 5.93% to 6.2%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 11 Per Share for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: $AVIA: Avia Avian will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 11 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~2.6% as of Monday (3/11) at 416 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 11, 2025, while payment is scheduled for November 20, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Records Net Loss of USD 38.8 Million in 3Q25, While Operating Profit Improves to ~$60 Million
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Garuda Indonesia recorded a net loss of 38.8 million US dollars in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: loss of 29.6 million US dollars, 2Q25: loss of 67.2 million US dollars), bringing the net loss for 9M25 to 182.5 million US dollars (vs. 9M24: loss of 131.2 million US dollars). Although revenue in 3Q25 tended to be flat quarterly (-11% YoY, +2% QoQ), GIAA still managed to record an increase in operating profit to ~$60 million (-34% YoY, +57% QoQ) with an operating profit margin in 3Q25 improving quarterly to 7% (vs. 3Q24: 10%, 2Q25: 5%). However, financial expenses reached ~110 million US dollars in 3Q25 (-30% YoY, -10% QoQ) and other income shrank (-99% YoY, -96% QoQ), so GIAA still posted a loss in 3Q25.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Subsidiary Obtains 6-Month Copper Concentrate Export Permit of 480,000 dmt Following Smelter Repairs
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional announced that its subsidiary, PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara, obtained an export recommendation for copper concentrate of 480,000 dmt valid for 6 months per October 31, 2025, from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources. The export permit was granted after the company's smelter had to temporarily cease operations in July-August 2025 due to repairs to the flash converting furnace unit and the sulfuric acid plant. The President Director of PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara, Rachmat Makkasau, stated that the smelter repair process is expected to continue until 1H26.
